title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Welcome

AI is transforming the way research is done
AI is rapidly evolving - tools and capability changing daily
Today I‚Äôll focus on tools I‚Äôve personally used, but this is by no means exhaustive!
Since tools are changing so rapidly, we‚Äôll also talk about best practices
I‚Äôm no AI expert - but an enthuastic (and optimistically skeptical) user
I also really want to hear from you

title: AI Tools for Research
section: AI can help with each stage of the research process
text:
AI can help with each stage of the research process

Idea generation
Literature review
Data analysis
Writing and communication
Collaboration and project management

title: AI Tools for Research
section: A bit on different LLM options
text:
A bit on different LLM options

Google‚Äôs Gemini

General purpose, good for lit review, idea generation, etc
Excellent data privacy protections through UCSB license

Anthropic‚Äôs Claude

Excellent for coding
Direct agentic integration with your IDE

GitHub Copilot

Designed for coding, integration with your IDE and Github
Can use many LLM backends (Gemini, Claude, GPT, etc.)

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Data privacy

Always check the data privacy policies of any AI tool you use
UCSB‚Äôs Gemini license has excellent protections

Approved for P1/P2/P3/P4 sensitive data
Your data is not used to train models
Available for faculty and staff

Claude Code has settings for data retention, whether your code is used to train models, etc

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Research process: Idea Generation

Gemini, Claude, GPT
Gemini Deep Research

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Research process: Literature Review

Google Scholar Labs
Gemini Deep Research
Gemini Notebook LM
Specialized tools: Research Rabbit, Nature Research Assistant, Elicit, Consensus

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Research process: Data analysis
Coding agents: GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Positron Assistant, Positron Databot

Integrated directly into your IDE
Have access to your codebase, file structure
Code generation (great for R, Python, etc)
Can operate in different modes: ask, edit, or agent, depending on your needs and comfort level
Can run commands (if you let it)
Great for data science workflows
Can even be used for machine learning model development
Usually ‚ÄúBYO-key‚Äù

Can use any LLM backend - Claude, Gemini, etc.
You‚Äôre also subject to that backend‚Äôs data privacy policies

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Positron Databot

Developed by Posit team (formerly RStudio) for Positron (modern, polyglot IDE alternative to RStudio based on VS Code)
Allows you to interact with your data using natural language
Designed for exploratory data analysis (can do ML too)
Designed with responsible, human-in-the-loop use in mind (Databot is not a flotation device)
Uses a WEAR loop: Write code, Execute, Analyze, Regroup


‚ÄúIn my 30-year career writing software professionally, Databot is both the most exciting software I‚Äôve worked on, and also the most dangerous.‚Äù
‚ÄìJoe Cheng, Posit CTO


To use Databot effectively and safely, you still need the skills of a data scientist. Databot is a set of fins that can make you swim faster and stronger, not a life vest.

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Positron Assistant

Developed by Posit team for Positron
A general coding assistant that can help with a wide range of coding tasks
Can be used for code generation, debugging, documentation, and more
Specifically tailored for data science workflows, with specific R and Python tooling
Has access to your codebase and file structure, so it can provide more context-aware assistance
BYOK: Can use various LLM backends (Gemini, Claude, etc.)
Can be used in ask, edit, or agent mode

title: AI Tools for Research
section: Using Claude directly vs GitHub Copilot with Claude?
text:
Using Claude directly vs GitHub Copilot with Claude?

Claude is requires a paid account
GitHub Copilot is free if you have an education account, but is otherwise paid as well
Using Claude directly gives you access to full context window - it is capped when going through Copilot
Using Claude directly is faster - otherwise everything goes through the Copilot proxy interface
GitHub Copilot adds in-line code completion

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Research process: Writing and Communication

Gemini, Claude, GPT
Gemini Nano Banana for image generation (e.g., schematics)
Specialized tools: Research Rabbit, Nature Research Assistant, Elicit, Consensus

title: AI Tools for Research
section: Research process: Collaboration and Project Management
text:
Research process: Collaboration and Project Management

GitHub Copilot for project management and collaboration

Can generate issues, pull requests, documentation, etc
Can be used to review code and suggest improvements
Can help with project organization and workflow

Various other AI-powered tools in Slack, Asana, Zoom, etc

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Examples

Vincent Arel-Bundock‚Äôs Use LLMs to learn about any chapter of my ùëÄùëúùëëùëíùëô ùë°ùëú ùëÄùëíùëéùëõùëñùëõùëî book, or any function in the marginaleffects package for R or Python. (light lift)
Pedro Sant‚ÄôAnna‚Äôs Comprehensive Guide to Multi-Agent Slide Development, Code Review, and Research Automation (heavy lift)

(Thanks, Robert!)

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Getting Started
Recommended First Steps:

Try Gemini for literature summaries
Become familiar with GitHub Copilot
Try a Positron coding assistent for your next data science task

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Resources

Free Copilot course from GitHub
Getting started with Positron Assistant

title: AI Tools for Research
text:
Best Practices

Verify AI-generated content - keep a human in the loop
Remain accountable
Cite usage appropriately
Check sources
Maintain data privacy
Document your workflow
Stay critical, skeptical, and curious

Discussion

What challenges have you faced with AI tools?
What are your thoughts on the ethical implications of AI in research?
What are your best practices for using AI?
